intro: Cnestis dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant contains milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family.
